alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:41PM EST until January 12 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pompton River At Pompton Plains affecting Morris and Passaic Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Pompton River at Pompton Plains. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The first flooding begins in the area of River Road and Harrison Street. At 16.0 feet, Residences on Pequannock Avenue along the river between Madison and Shady streets become surrounded by water. Businesses along Route 23 north begin to flood. At 17.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Roosevelt Street becomes impassable. Route 23 exit ramp at Alexander Avenue becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EST Thursday was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by around midnight. Levels will continue to fall Friday. More rains will arrive Friday night and levels will rise again this weekend. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.4 feet on 08/23/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Pompton River Pompton Plains 16.0 16.4 Thu 8 pm 13.3 15.4 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EST.
